comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: A hard-throwing, fast-living left-hander, Rube Benton pitched professionally for 24 years, compiling a 150-144 record and 3.09 ERA in his 15 seasons in the National League. Benton had a reputation for drinking, gambling, and driving too fast, all three of which combined in various ways to interrupt his major-league career. He eventually died at age 47 from injuries suffered in a car crash. read all about it.... bioproj.sabr.org/bioproj.cfm?a=v&v=l&pid=951&...
